alert.note: Alert for Deuel; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 18 at 9:36AM CDT until June 19 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... South Platte River near Roscoe affecting Deuel and Keith Counties. .Runoff from rainfall in Colorado has led to elevated river levels along the South Platte River in southwestern Nebraska. River levels will remain above minor flood stage through Monday evening. For the South Platte River...including Roscoe...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Platte River near Roscoe. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flood Stage. Minor flooding of agricultural land along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM MDT Sunday was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.3 feet midnight MDT tonight. It will then fall below the flood stage of 9.0 feet by midnight MDT Monday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 06/16/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 930 AM MDT.
